intro: Erepsia bracteata, commonly known as the bracted erpesia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant features bracts, which are modified leaves that surround the flower clusters, giving it its common name. Erepsia bracteata is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
